subject: Sleep
title: Dreams and Memory Consolidation
description: A quick win: understand Dreams and Memory Consolidation.

hook.text: Students who studied a maze before sleep dreamed about mazes that night and solved them faster the next day.

buildup.text: During REM, the hippocampus replays daily experiences to the cortex for long-term storage.

discovery.text: Dreams may be the conscious experience of this replay process, a window into memory filing.

twist.text: The replay is not exact. The brain remixes and connects new memories with old ones, creating strange plots.

climax.text: That's why dreams blend yesterday's meeting with your childhood school. The brain is cross-referencing.

punchline.text: Dreams might be your brain's filing system at work.

quiz.question: Why do dreams often mix recent and old memories?
options: The brain is cross-referencing new and old memories
